CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 22, 1951, page 26, reads: "Mailing a Letter to Santa Claus - Maybe it was the severly cold day, or perhaps the mailing slot was too high, or perhaps just the photographer frightened her, but darling, little Darlene Baker was just about to cry a wee bit when Photographer Charles (Teenie) Harris snapped this picture of her sister Roberta, and Darlene as they were about to mail this letter to Santa Claus. Never mind, Darlene, a letter to Santa Claus ought to be just a private matter. Perhaps you are right. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Two sisters, Roberta and Darlene Baker, stand on the sidewalk to mail a letter to Santa Claus in the snow
